--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...> wrote:
>
> Bruce
>    
>   I am sorry that you have to experience that but it goes hand in 
hand with what we do. I agree totally with Frank Ratka on this. I 
learned along time ago that I am not doing this for recognition, 
fame, fortune, popularity, or to prove to anyone. Instead I approach 
it as I am the researcher, I am the student, I am learning. 
>    
>   I no longer waste my time talking to people who interfere or have 
a negative approach to the results we all get. I would much rather 
spend my few hours of free time talking to you guys or conducting 
more experiments.
>    
>   I know it can be hard to ignore negativity but if you do not 
ignore it then you yourself can become part of that negativity or be 
consumed by it entirely. So share, but do not react to negative 
feedback...enlighten but do not seek to impress.
>    
>   You are doing fine I see you uploaded a bunch of files I see some 
have personal details...is this proof for Y O U...thats what is 
important. Did they prove to you without a doubt that something 
extraordinary went on during that session. If the answer was yes then 
you know that you are on the right track. Dont let anyone pull you 
off that path or obstruct your moving forward.
>    
>   Misty
>    
>    
>    
>   
> Frank <warrior18eii@...> wrote:
>           Bruce,
> 
> The best way to deal with the naysayers is to ignore them. We will
> always have people saying such things and fighting with them only
> negatively effects your own contact field. In the end you will not
> convince them of anything.
> 
> In my case I answer what I think are legitimate questions from 
sincere
> people. Some of those turn out to be the naysayers who want to 
argue,
> I drop the conversation and move on. 
> 
> I look at it this way. If they have to ask how it works then they
> don't know and feel enough to understand anything I would have to 
tell
> them. They think it is a completely "technical" process, when the 
most
> important components are the links between the two communicators.
> 
> As Misty and I have talked about in the past I was one who use to 
jump
> at any opportunity to "fight the skeptics". I have since learned 
that
> it is a pointless waste of energy and it does do damage to your
> contact field or bridge if you have established one. The turmoil and
> negative emotions controversy spawns are not conducive to the types 
of
> communications we have been experimenting with.
> 
> Some of those skeptics genuinely want to learn what we know but just
> can't grasp the basics needed to perpetuate this reality. Others 
just
> want to get you worked up and off balance. By ignoring negative
> contacts you are protecting your connection to your higher self. 
Don't
> fall for their traps!
> 
> Best Regards,
> 
> Frank Ratka
